definition: honorific title/form of address reserved for a queen, ancestor, emperor etc
senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: More than this, the pope has been given the very titles of Deity.
sentences.chinese: 此外，更有甚者，就是教皇已僭称了上帝的尊号。

sentences.english: Thus the most outstanding poet always desires to be made a poet laureate .
sentences.chinese: 因此最杰出的诗人总希望获得桂冠诗人的尊号。

definition: temple name of a deceased Chinese emperor
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
posthumous name and title
title of honor/term of respect
to appoint sb to a post or confer a title on sb by imperial order
official name of a nation (includes dynastic names of China: 漢|汉[Han4], 唐[Tang2] etc)
to seal up (a door with a paper seal, or a document)/to confer an additional title on a nobleman
posthumous honorific name
to receive fief and title/to be enfeoffed/(fig.) to be rewarded by the emperor
worship/to revere/to venerate
imperial throne
to change an emperor's or ruler's reign title (old)
to ascend the throne
to confer a posthumous title
to confer a title on (an empress or a prince)
to succeed to the throne
